body:
Use `--` to separate the run flags from the module flag. It is the convention to stop parsing flags:

```
$ ipython -c"%run -m run_test -- --option"
['/Users/bussonniermatthias/eraseme/test.py', '--option']
```

Perhaps this convention should be mentioned in the help documents (i.e., with `%run?`)? It's not obvious (to me) and it introduces an inconsistency between IPython and the usual CPython. For example, this is the correct way to call the file (without the `-m` option):

``` bash
$ ipython -c"%run run_test.py --option"
['run_test.py', '--option']
```

No `--` required. Also, should it match the command-line syntax for python? That is:

``` bash
$ python -m run_test --option  
['/path/to/dir/run_test.py', '--option']
$ ipython -m run_test --option 
... help text ...
[TerminalIPythonApp] CRITICAL | Unrecognized flag: '--option'
$ ipython -m run_test -- --option 
['/path/to/dir/run_test.py', u'--option']
```

Not that IPython should match the reference implementation in all details, but I would argue that it should be documented.

The `--` is a standard in unix, and not something we did add for this to work, so I doubt we should document it:

```
~/eraseme $ ls -- -al
ls: -al: No such file or directory
~/eraseme $ ls -al
total 40
drwxr-xr-x  12 bussonniermatthias  staff   408B May 15 12:10 .
drwxr-xr-x+ 54 bussonniermatthias  staff   1.8K May 15 12:10 ..
drwxr-xr-x   3 bussonniermatthias  staff   102B May 11 17:36 .ipynb_checkpoints
-rw-r--r--   1 bussonniermatthias  staff   523B May 15 12:10 .test.py.un~
-rw-r--r--   1 bussonniermatthias  staff   8.1K May 11 22:37 Untitled.ipynb
drwxr-xr-x   3 bussonniermatthias  staff   102B May 15 12:10 __pycache__
drwxr-xr-x   2 bussonniermatthias  staff    68B May 11 17:32 nomod
-rw-r--r--   1 bussonniermatthias  staff     0B May 11 17:32 pack.py
-rw-r--r--   1 bussonniermatthias  staff     0B May 11 17:32 packpyc.pyc
-rw-r--r--   1 bussonniermatthias  staff    41B May 15 12:10 test.py
drwxr-xr-x   5 bussonniermatthias  staff   170B May 11 17:33 xmod
-rw-r--r--   1 bussonniermatthias  staff     0B May 11 17:44 xxx.py
```

There are probably a lot of other differences in the option parsing that will be different than the shell, 
I'm a bit worried of the complexity it adds. I don't disagree that we could be closer to the python way, I might just not append that soon.

Also if you start executing python callable modules using `%run` and passing option, it might be a sign that actually importing the module and calling the api is a route to investigate.

I also ran into this issue because I was running a Python module as a command line interface (the command line interface was implemented using argparse).  Using the `--` separator, mentioned above, did the trick.  The IPython documentation didn't mention anything about this.  I was lucky enough to stumble upon this GitHub issue through Google search.
